page.title: 01Cottingham and Skidby.
page.content:
The area covered includes part of Cottingham, the whole of the village of Skidby and the tiny hamlet of Risby.
The part of Cottingham covered contains a great deal of housing built in the last twenty years and part of a small estate of council housing.
The village of Skidby, nestling in a dip in the Yorkshire Wolds, is very pretty. Its most obvious feature is a windmill, standing on a site where there has been a mill for several hundred years.
Risby now consists of one farm but is shown on maps as a small hamlet. The fields on either side of the farm contain the earthworks of Risby Hall.
